meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone by pretending something is true when it is not.
meanings.sent1: She faked being sick to skip school.
meanings.sent2: He faked his signature on the document.
meanings.sent3: The cat faked being stuck in a box for attention.
meanings.sent4: Her smile faked happiness, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The magician faked pulling a rabbit out of a hat.

meanings.definition: To create a false impression of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist faked the texture of the painting.
meanings.sent2: He faked enthusiasm for the boring presentation.
meanings.sent3: The student faked interest in the lecture to impress the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The actor faked tears during the emotional scene.
meanings.sent5: The chef faked the appearance of a gourmet dish with simple ingredients.

meanings.sent1: The faked designer bag looked real at first glance.
meanings.sent2: His faked smile did not reach his eyes.
meanings.sent3: The faked diamond ring sparkled brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The faked leather jacket felt cheap and plastic.
